   88 YO s/p mechanical fall 6 days ago. Presented to OSH with persistent
   neck pain. CT showed C2 fx, L rib fxs, & ? chronic T3 compression fx,
   and a RLL PNA. Pt has no neuro deficits.
   Fall(s)
   Assessment:
          Patient awake and alert; oriented to time and person only.
   Very confused in regards to place; does not reorient; Restless and
   agitated at times in bed; MAEW, follows commands but forgetful and does
   pull at lines/C Collar; PERRLA;
          TLS cleared by neurosurg
          [**Location (un) 1083**] J collar remain intact [**12-21**] C2 fx
          LS coarse with scattered rhonchi; occasional congested
   nonproductive cough; No SOB; O2 sat 92-98% on RA, but frequently pulls
   off O2; achieved 750 on IS
          HR 70-90
s; afib with frequent PVC
s, with short runs of
   Vtach at times on monitor; Patient denies CP; Patient hypertensive to
   190/90
s; No edema, ppp, +csm
          Abd soft, NT/ND, BS+4; No c/o NVD: remains NPO
          Foley patent with CYU in good amts
          Patient denies pain
   Action:
          Neurochecks as per trauma orders; frequent reorienting and
   repositioning of patient
          Family in and encouraged family participation
          Encouraged TCDB and IS- patient w/ rib fx and high risk for
   pneumonia
          EKG and echo done
          [**Location (un) 1083**] J collar intact and cervical spine precautions
   maintained
   Response:
          Patient remains confused and disoriented
          No change in neurological status
          Patient maintained O2 sat >90%; No increased difficulty
   respirations noted
   Plan:
          Transfer to CC6
          Patient will need MRI of cspine and thoracic spine this
   evening
          Monitor neuro status
          Maintain cervical spine precautions until cleared
